greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number which can be represented as the sum of distinct squares of primes in exactly n ways, or 0 if no such integer exists.
link: Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
example: a(2) = 410 because 410 = 7^2 + 19^2 = 11^2 + 17^2 and this is the smallest number that can be written as the sum of distinct squares of primes in 2 different ways.
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jun 03 2017
